alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"... Here mathematics is reduced to an intellectual game, like chess -- again a completely subjective approach. The Intuitionist school is equally determined to separate mathematics from objective reality. A mathematical formula, according to these people, is not supposed to represent anything existing independently of the act of computation itself. This has been compared to the attempt of Bohr to use the discoveries of quantum mechanics to introduce new views of physical and mathematical quantities as divorced from objective reality."

(cont'd)
